question: While determining the coefficient of viscosity of the given liquid, a spherical steel ball sinks by a distance <katex>$h=0.9$</katex> m. The radius of the ball <katex>$r=\sqrt{3} \times 10^{-3}$</katex> m. The time taken by the ball to sink in three trails are 2.75, 2.65, 2.70 s. The difference between the densities of the steel ball and the liquid is <katex>$7000 \text{ kg m}^{-3}$</katex>. If <katex>$g=10 \text{ ms}^{-2}$</katex>, then the coefficient of viscosity is
